Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2012 07:41AM Husker123 wrote: My BS was going to put my port in when I did the BMX but didn't. We weren't sure I was going to have to have chemo at that point. She did it about 4 weeks later after all my results were in. My PS is going to take it out when we do the exchange surgery on 8/29.  I'm not going to miss it a bit but it did make chemo a lot easier!
Posts.Title: Port insertion during bmx and LD recon surgery. Yes or No? cgesq kayakgirl

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2012 03:53PM Husker123 wrote: I was diagnosed on Jan. 27th. Was orginally scheduled to have surgery on Feb. 17th but my BS decided to do an MRI & make sure there was nothing lurking in my other breast. Sure enough, I had to go for another biopsy and they found cancer in my right breast also. I opted for a masectomy at that point. It took until March 27 for both the BS & PS to be available. I didn't enjoy the wait but it was worth it. Best of luck to you!
Posts.Title: Length of time between diagnosis and treatment (surgery) michellej1980 michellej1980

I'm hoping I can go topless by 8 weeks PFC. That would be like a dream! My leg hair sure has figured out how to make a return! It could have stayed gone.....

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2012 09:14AM Husker123 wrote: Good luck ONVACATION and RACHEL11! We all finish today. It's been suggested to me that I do a butt waggle on the way out the door! LOL! Hair check in.  Lots of white fuzz and some darker stubble coming in on my head. Eyebrows are almost non existant. Lashes are holding up good. I can't use mascara (allergic to it) and I had permanent eyeliner tattoed about 4 years ago. Maybe it makes a difference? Southern hair is thinner but still there. Have to shave my legs about every 2 weeks. Arm hair never left. Hope all have a good day!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 10, 2012 06:16PM Husker123 wrote: I had a good report from the MO today. My blood levels were good. Guess the Neulasta was worth the body aches.  She scolded me for losing 5 lbs. I told her I had been eating but just had changed to healthier diet..... That and a TON of water.  Trust me, those 5 lbs won't be missed at all. I could lose another 20 easy and still be chubbier than I want.  She also was surprised that I had so few SE's. Warned me not to hold my breath that it would be the same on the next go round. I think I'm going to make it my mission to prove her wrong!  My SIL's got together and sent me some cool hats and scarves in the mail. I'm dreading when the hair loss begins.  Hoping everyone else is doing well.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 19, 2012 09:19AM Husker123 wrote: Rachel11, we are right on schedule together. My hair (what's left of it) is getting buzzed today too. I'm scheduled for my next TC on Thursday. Hoping it goes as well as the last. Hope everyone has a good weekend & minimal SE's.

She said because it hadn't been gone for 6 months, I'm looking at Tamoxifen for 3 years then something else..

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2012 09:57AM Husker123 wrote: My hair is trying to come back. I have lots of little baby ones trying to come in. Waiting to see if #3 knocks them out by next week but it's a little encouraging to see & feel the little buggers! No pit hair, some down south yet, arm hair is intact, and legs still need a shave every now & then. Sure is funny how we all differ! My eyebrows are thin but I can kind of fudge & make them look ok. No lash problems yet.  Good luck to all in the BGC this week!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 2, 2012 06:45PM Husker123 wrote: Thanks for the hydration advice StayShiny.  I've done a pretty good job with it today. The steroids make me a little jittery but nothing I can't live with. My MO already told me to get the Claritin so am covered there too. I'm pleasantly surprised that my mind isn't messing with me today. I think I got my mind made up that tomorrow is the first day towards the end of this roller coaster I've been on. YA for you OnVacation!!!!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 7, 2012 11:11AM Husker123 wrote: I made it thru the weekend. The Nulasta did give me some bone pain. I tried to tough it out with Advil until a good friend reminded me in that there was a REASON they give you pain pills and take the darn things!  I slept well both Sat & Sun night! I woke up in a major fog yesterday morning. Just felt goofy! It cleared up after awhile but it was the strangest feeling. Plus my mouth was tingly and sort of numb. So strange. I guess the taste thing has already decided to kick in. I made pizza for supper last night & it was cardboard to me. What do all of you find that you just don't taste anymore? I did get up feeling like a human being this morning! There may be hope for me.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2012 08:02PM Husker123 wrote: Yay Slak for being DONE!  I'm counting the weeks..... At my MO appt the other day, she was already fast forwarding to after I was done. Talking about Tamoxifen and some tests I'd need run first. When I could have my exchange surgery & my port out!  That was a fun conversation!  I don't have to do radiation so this all ends a little sooner for me than some. Hoping everyone is having a good weekend & light SE's.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2012 07:40AM Husker123 wrote: Onvacation, we are on the same schedule! I just want to fast forward to July 5! Good luck to you tomorrow & we'll hope for no burping or rash!

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 08:38AM Husker123 wrote: #3 did a better number on me than the first 2. So tired & in a fog. I didn't really get to enjoy my family. I was in a fog the whole time they were here. It's sad because that was the first time for meeting my brother's girlfriend. I really liked her & won't get to see her again for some time. They headed back to Santa Fe on Sat. Yesterday was a do nothing day. Couldn't find anything I was interested in doing or could concentrate on. So, I napped a lot! Today I feel like I'm a little more with it. I'll be so glad when #4 is history & I start finding my new "normal"! I hope everyone had a good weekend with light SE's!

Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 19, 2012 09:59AM Husker123 wrote: I have a wig Rachel. I'm not sure if I'll wear it or not. I just feel weird in it. It's really close to my hair color & cut but I don't know.... Mine is buzzed. Boy, I didn't know I had that many grey hairs coming in! I think that was the worst shock! A couple of friends gave me a tip of using a leave in hair conditioner on the stubble. It does help it quit hurting.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 24, 2012 09:13PM Husker123 wrote: Summer51 and Rachel11, how did it go? Mine was good after they finally got my port working. They could flush but not draw blood. I bet they flushed it 10 times before it worked right. They said it's not uncommon. I drank about 60 ounces of ice tea & water while I was getting the infusion. I feel alot better right now. I'll take my Zofran in a bit & probably hit the sack.  My MO & nurse navigator decided I have a really nice shaped head. Hubby thought maybe I should just keep the bald look going.  I think that is NOT going to happen! Hoping for minimal SE's for all!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 31, 2012 09:18PM Husker123 wrote: Slak, I found a good skunk smell remover.  1 qt peroxide, 1/4 cup baking soda, and a dab of dish soap.  I used it on my dog about a month ago. I took him outside & used a sponge to lather him up & rinsed him off with the garden hose. It really got rid of the smell!   Had my visit with the MO today. All my blood levels were good. (knock on wood) Tired seems to be my major SE from the 2nd infusion. Nothing sounds good for food.  But compared to a lot of ladies here, I have nothing to complain about! Wishing everyone minimal SE's!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2012 06:16PM Husker123 wrote: Rachel, I have the tingling in my hands too. I had it some from the first go around but it went away.  This seems to be hanging around.  My MO said it should go away after I'm all done.  #3 next Thursday for me too. Yay for Lynnbea for being done!!!!  Hope the hair grows soon Slak!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2012 06:29AM Husker123 wrote: That guy was really nice Summer! A good bright spot in an otherwise cruddy day. My day in the BGC was good. They opened another room where I go. It's only 4 chairs but each one has it's own tv. It's much quieter there. I hope I get to go back down there for my last treatment on July 5. They even wrote on my appt. card LAST CHEMO! My friend & I went to lunch afterward. It must not have set well with me. I was feeling a little queasy when I got home. The nausea meds. got that stopped but then had to go for a short ride on the D-train. That seems to have quit so I'm really thinking it was lunch. Thanks for the advice on the fingers. I will keep moisturiser on them & my feet. I have my Dad & brother & their lady friends coming to visit today. Guess they will understand when I kick them out so I can go get my Neulasta shot! I guess since I'm up, I should go clean house & try to make it looks somewhat presentable. Good luck to all in the BGC today!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51
